<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Saturday morning. </strong>We’re shedding more tears than at the end of <em>Toy Story 3</em> as we say goodbye to Morning Brew’s Streaming Week, where we explored the industry that spawned Disney+. We hoped you learned something, and if not, here’s a quick refresher…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Mickey’s originally proposed name was Mortimer Mouse</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Cord-cutters will account for over 15% of the U.S. population this year</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>You could be watching some major professional sports exclusively on a tech platform come 2021 </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We're closing out the week by exploring the future of streaming. But first, the news. </p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INTERNET
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/uk-labour-party-pushes-nationalization-internet?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Can I Interest You in Free Internet?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="big ben and fiber optics" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczODUyODQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If there’s one thing that’ll make you yearn for Brexit news, it’s British Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn announcing a plan to <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-14/u-k-labour-pledges-to-nationalize-bt-s-openreach-broadband-unit?srnd=premium-europe&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">nationalize</a><span> part of the</span> digital infrastructure of phone carrier BT. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But yearn not. With elections slated for Dec. 12, the plan to <span>give all consumers free fiber broadband within a decade </span>became a major talking point in the U.K. yesterday. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Lay of the land </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Britain’s mean <a href="https://fortune.com/2019/11/15/uk-election-free-broadband-labour/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">download speed</a> of 22.4 megabits per second put it in <a href="https://www.cable.co.uk/broadband/speed/worldwide-speed-league/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">35th place</a> globally last year—not great, especially compared to other European countries. The current government acknowledges more investment is needed to better connect the rural parts of the U.K. to the internet.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But Corbyn is taking things up 22.4 notches with a proposal to provide free, full-fiber connectivity across the U.K. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“What was once a luxury is now an essential utility,” Corbyn said. “I think it’s too important to be left to the corporations. Only the government has the planning ability, economies of scale and ambition to take this on.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The other side: </strong></span><span>Conservative Prime Minister Boris Johnson thinks the policy is a “crazed communist scheme.” And Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/nov/15/free-broadband-essential-uk-compete-john-mcdonnell-labour-policy-openreach?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">quipped</a></span><span>, “Labour are on track to beat their last manifesto record of using the word ‘free’ 39 times.”</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">How nationalization works</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Labour would turn BT’s broadband operations and related units into a state-run company called <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/british-labour-party-plans-to-nationalize-telecoms-if-it-gains-power-11573842024?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">British Broadband</a>. Current BT shareholders would be compensated in government bonds, but analysts expect the assets to be undervalued during the transaction. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>And when you build a great, big broadband network on your digital border, who pays for it? Big Tech. Labour plans to partially fund the $26 billion project with a tax on internet giants like Facebook, Amazon, and Google. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>History is <a href="https://apnews.com/04485e9d13214220828687fc98c1408f?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">repeating itself</a>. Labour governments went on a nationalizing spree after WWII, until Margaret Thatcher’s Conservative government went on a <em>privatizing </em>spree in the 1980s. Now, Corbyn and Labour want to nationalize the water companies, the postal service, and some railways. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Reality check: </strong>Labour is trailing in the polls and isn’t expected to gain much power in the election.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
INVESTING
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/hedge-funds-piled-alibaba-q3?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Hedge Funds: The Biggest Risk Is not Taking One
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="bloomberg visual of hedge fund investment" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczODUyOTg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/where-hedge-funds-invest-13F/?srnd=premium" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Bloomberg</a></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With $3.2 billion in new holding value, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba was the <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/where-hedge-funds-invest-13F/?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">top buy</a> for hedge funds in Q3, according to Bloomberg. That’s surprising given the uncertainty around the U.S.-China trade war. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Break it down: </strong>Bloomberg sorted through the data hedge funds <a href="https://nypost.com/2018/11/14/one-of-the-biggest-days-for-hedge-funds-often-goes-unnoticed/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">traditionally</a> publish 45 days before the new year (today) to determine who’s investing and who’s not.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">And we learned risk, not Freeman, is Stan Druckenmiller’s middle name. Uber was a popular buy with $2.2 billion in new holding value. FYI, Uber shares are down ~14% since last quarter.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Traditionally “safer” bets like Disney (down $1.4 billion in holding value) and Microsoft (down $1.7 billion) made Jillian Michaels proud.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong><a href="https://finance.yahoo.com/news/hedge-funds-shop-netflix-facebook-235929426.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">FAANG</a> stocks are still a faan favorite, but hedge funds also bet big on the broader market in Q3. The market-tracking SPDR S&P 500 ETF banked $2.3 billion in new holding value.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/twitter-gives-details-political-ad-policy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Twitter Changes Color Scheme to Gray
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczODU2MzQwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Drew Angerer, Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Things that sound simple in theory but are complicated in practice: being the big spoon, waxing, and Twitter’s ban on political advertisements.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When Twitter announced that ban last month, it earned wide <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/15/tech/twitter-political-ad-rules/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">praise</a> mostly for not being Facebook, which still allows political ads. Yesterday, Twitter revealed <a href="https://www.axios.com/twitter-political-ad-rules-10b6b742-12d1-44a5-8a2e-32aafa800d47.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fresh details</a>... </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What’s banned:</strong> “Content that <a href="https://www.vox.com/recode/2019/11/15/20966908/twitter-political-ad-ban-policies-issue-ads-jack-dorsey?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">references</a> a candidate, political party, elected or appointed governmental official, election, referendum, ballot measure, legislation, regulation, directive, or judicial outcome.”</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Twitter’s also limiting micro-targeting, or serving ads </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitter-to-restrict-how-certain-advertisers-target-users-11573842679?mod=hp_lead_pos2&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">based on</a></span><span> things like ZIP code or political affiliation, on issues-based ads related to civic engagement, the economy, etc.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Who’s banned:</strong> Candidates, parties, government officials, PACs, and political nonprofits. For-profit companies can run ads to raise awareness around issues, but those ads can’t advocate for specific political outcomes. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Scientists say exercise is good for you" is fine.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Vote for my law abolishing school and enshrining 24/7 recess"...not so much.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The line is fine.</strong> Twitter’s policy leaves <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/15/technology/twitter-political-ad-policy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">room for interpretation</a> defining ads for <em>issues</em> vs. ads for <em>outcomes</em>. And it doesn't do much to address disinformation. </p>

</a><span>  </span>

<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e8657887c532.jpg">
</a>
</td>
</tr>

</th>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/trump-admin-wants-hospitals-reveal-prices?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Trump Admin Wants Healthcare to Fight Fair
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Raise your hand if you’ve had this experience: twist ankle → go to doctor → get told it’s probably fine but might have foot diarrhea → receive $4,372 bill. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Trump administration <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/15/health/list-hospital-prices-trump.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">said it plans</a> to fix that by requiring hospitals to publicize the rates they negotiate with insurers. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Those rates have been the most closely guarded secret in the healthcare industry, aside from whether or not coffee is good for you. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">If passed, the move would turn the industry upside down</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The administration says disclosing the rates would <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-administration-releases-transparency-rule-in-hospital-pricing-11573825649?mod=hp_lead_pos3&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">generate competition</a> among <span>doctors</span> and push prices down. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>The administration also floated a rule that would force insurers to inform people about their </span><span><span>estimated</span></span><span> out-of-pocket costs prior to </span><span><span>seeing a doctor or going to a hospital</span></span><span>. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>The 2020 election is at the next exit, and some of President Trump’s Democratic rivals are polling <span>higher</span> on the issue of healthcare.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>expect the industry to wage a legal fight.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F15%2Ftrump-admin-wants-hospitals-reveal-prices" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Those+rates+have+been+the+most+closely+guarded+secret+in+the+healthcare+industry&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/trump-admin-wants-hospitals-reveal-prices&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F15%2Ftrump-admin-wants-hospitals-reveal-prices&title=Trump+Admin+Wants+Hospitals+to+Reveal+Prices+&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Those+rates+have+been+the+most+closely+guarded+secret+in+the+healthcare+industry" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86576e04837.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="/cdn-cgi/l/email-protection#" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SPONSORED BY CARIUMA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
You’re Silly if You Don’t Sport These Sneakers
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" style="text-decoration:none;border:none;" target="_blank" class="">
<img alt="Cariuma" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNjQ4NDg1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
</a>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em></em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’re pretty selective here around the Brew offices. We want the best. If anything doesn’t look right–down to our shoes–we scrap it and start over.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That’s why we all rock <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA</a> sneakers every day. It’s a little weird, frankly, and a bit of a fashion faux pas, but we don’t care. <em>That’s how good we all look</em>, rocking our <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMAs</a> together.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Why do we all rock with these foot puppies?</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They’re</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> good-looking.</strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They’re </span><span><strong style="color:#000">crazy</strong></span><span> </span><span><strong style="color:#000">comfortable</strong></span><span>.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>They’re</span><span><strong style="color:#000"> consciously made.</strong></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Much like the old-school styles <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMA</a> comes out with on the regular, the reasons to wear these sneakers are simple, yet undeniable.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Pardon our French, but you’re downright silly if you don’t make <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CARIUMAs</a> a part of your daily routine. (And, just saying, there’s a waitlist.)</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today, CARIUMA has a special offer for Brew readers: <a href="https://cariuma.com/pages/morning-brew-nov?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=sponsored+email&utm_campaign=weekly&utm_content=x16Nov19" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Rock a discounted pair with us, people</a>.</p>
</td>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/future-streaming-phone?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The Future of Streaming Is on Your Phone
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="An illustration of a 3D castle emerging from a smartphone screen" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MTk0L2FuX2lsbHVzdHJhdGlvbl9vZl9hXzNkX2Nhc3RsZV9lbWVyZ2luZ19mcm9tX2Ffc21hcnRwaG9uZV9zY3JlZW4uanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>FunkyFocus/Pixabay</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With two new competitors this month and two more in the on-deck circle, streaming feels like it’s reached a saturation point. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">So...what’s next? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We’ve seen experiments in <a href="https://www.fastcompany.com/90326433/what-history-teaches-us-about-the-future-of-interactive-tv?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">interactive</a> content (Netflix’s <em>Black Mirror: </em><em>Bandersnatch</em>, a choose-your-own-adventure movie) and <a href="https://fortune.com/longform/virtual-reality-struggle-hope-vr/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">virtual reality</a>, but the next wave of streaming might happen on your phone. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The startup to watch:</strong> Quibi, short for “quick bites,” <a href="https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2019-07-31/can-quibi-reinvent-mobile-storytelling?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrives</a> in April under the leadership of former Disney Chairman Jeffrey Katzenberg and former HPE CEO Meg Whitman. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Users will pay $5/month for ad-supported streaming or $8/month for an ad-free version on Quibi’s app. The target audience? 18<span>–</span>35-year-olds who want a few minutes of entertainment while scarfing down Sweetgreen at their desks. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Each video will log around 10 minutes. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The confirmed list of creators includes heavyweights like Steven Spielberg, Queen Latifah, and Trevor Noah. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The goal: </strong>Katzenberg <a href="https://fortune.com/longform/katzenberg-whitman-hollywood-mobile-streaming-quibi/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a> Fortune that “five or 10 years from now, we’ll look back and go, ‘There was the era of movies, there was the era of television, and there’s the era of Quibi.’” </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">He’s not lacking confidence, and Quibi’s not lacking advertisers. Six months before launch, Quibi said it <a href="https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/23/streaming-service-quibi-sells-out-of-its-150m-in-first-year-ad-inventory/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">sold out</a> all $150 million of its first-year ad inventory. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em>Want to go deeper on Quibi and other content innovations? <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/15/whats-next-streaming?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Read this</a>. </em></p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
BREW'S BETS
</h3>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">People lie, numbers don’t</strong></span><span>. </span><span><a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-balance-transfer-review/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-disbt-1116br-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">This card</a></span><span> offers 0% APR for 18 months on balance transfers. That’s big time savings. Oh yeah, and it gives you the chance to rake in crazy cash back deals. For $0 annual fee. Those numbers? They speak for themselves. </span><span><a href="https://www.fool.com/the-ascent/credit-cards/landing/discover-it-balance-transfer-review/?utm_site=theascent&utm_campaign=ta-cc-co-mb-disbt-1116br-5-na-na&utm_medium=cpc&utm_source=mb" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apply for the card here</a></span><span>.* </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">“There’s nothing like a child’s imagination</strong></span><span>.” Whoever said that was talking about kids who play with </span><span><a href="https://www.kiwico.com/m/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=Paid_Partners&utm_term=EMAIL" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">KiwiCo</a></span><span> projects. KiwiCo delivers hands-on activities to spark creativity in kids of all ages. They’ve shipped over 13 million expert-designed projects to date. Get early access to KiwiCo’s </span><span><a href="https://www.kiwico.com/m/morningbrew?utm_source=morningbrew&utm_medium=Paid_Partners&utm_term=EMAIL" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Black Friday sale here</a></span><span>.*</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Weekend conversation starters</strong></span><span>, for when your date has the language proficiency of a well-trained husky:
</span><span><ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Is there a right (</span><span><a href="https://www.huffpost.com/entry/pete-buttigieg-cinnamon-roll-viral-photo_n_5dc706cce4b00927b23405ba" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">and very wrong</a></span><span>) way to eat a cinnamon roll? </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Which is correct: boil water before adding pasta, or </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/drive45music/status/1183880890490875905" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">add pasta to cold water</a></span><span> and then boil?</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>An ethical dilemma: consuming Pokémon flesh—</span><span><a href="https://www.polygon.com/2019/11/15/20963329/pokemon-sword-shield-slow-poke-tail-curry-sausage" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">yea or nay</a></span><span>?</span>
</li>
</ol></span><span>
</span>
</li>
</ul>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FROM THE CREW
</h3>
</td>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">You may be right, but we’re not crazy.</strong> Yesterday, we asked whether you sing along or cringe when “Piano Man” comes on at a party. The vast majority said “sing along” (though some admitted it takes a few drinks). Here are a few highlights from the inbox...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“How dare you? Not only do I sing along at a party when it comes on, but I am close to being moved to tears. That song may go down as one of the greatest masterpieces ever written.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Who cringes to Piano Man? That’s just poor taste. I may be biased though because it was the closing song to mine and my wife’s wedding…”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“Regarding Piano Man...before beer = cringe. After beer(s) = at the top of my lungs.”</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>“I leave the party and start looking for better quality friends”</span></li>
</ul>
</td>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Here are some Saturday Headlines to warm you up after a frigid week. We’ll give you three real headlines from the week and one we conjured out of thin air. Can you spot the fake? </p>
<ol>

<span>“JetBlue </span><span><a href="https://media.giphy.com/media/E6O2RDUXzZ3eE/giphy.gif?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">rolls out</a></span><span> ‘Ok boomer’ promotion for $39 flights to Florida”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Two people </span><span><a href="https://www.theguardian.com/world/2019/nov/13/two-people-diagnosed-with-pneumonic-plague-in-china?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">diagnosed</a></span><span> with pneumonic plague in China”</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“Twinkies cereal is </span><span><a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/13/twinkies-cereal-is-now-in-the-works.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">now in the works</a></span><span>”</span>

<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>“</span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=SaIbR5tVuvM&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">What it takes</a></span><span> to maintain the biggest hedges in the U.K.”</span>
</li>

style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGood Saturday morning. \u003c/strong\u003eWe’re shedding more tears than at the end of \u003cem\u003eToy Story 3\u003c/em\u003e as we say goodbye to Morning Brew’s Streaming Week, where we explored the industry that spawned Disney+. We hoped you learned something, and if not, here’s a quick refresher…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMickey’s originally proposed name was Mortimer Mouse\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eCord-cutters will account for over 15% of the U.S. population this year\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eYou could be watching some major professional sports exclusively on a tech platform come 2021 \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe're closing out the week by exploring the future of streaming. style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nINTERNET\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Internet?\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"big ben and fiber optics\" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczODUyODQ1LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIf there’s one thing that’ll make you yearn for Brexit news, it’s British Labour Party leader Jeremy Corbyn announcing a plan to \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-14/u-k-labour-pledges-to-nationalize-bt-s-openreach-broadband-unit?srnd=premium-europe\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003enationalize\u003c/a\u003e\u003cspan\u003e part of the\u003c/span\u003e digital infrastructure of phone carrier BT. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut yearn not. With elections slated for Dec. 12, the plan to \u003cspan\u003egive all consumers free fiber broadband within a decade \u003c/span\u003ebecame a major talking point in the U.K. yesterday. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLay of the land \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBritain’s mean \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/2019/11/15/uk-election-free-broadband-labour/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edownload speed\u003c/a\u003e of 22.4 megabits per second put it in \u003ca href=\"https://www.cable.co.uk/broadband/speed/worldwide-speed-league/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003e35th place\u003c/a\u003e globally last year—not great, especially compared to other European countries. The current government acknowledges more investment is needed to better connect the rural parts of the U.K. to the internet.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut Corbyn is taking things up 22.4 notches with a proposal to provide free, full-fiber connectivity across the U.K. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e“What was once a luxury is now an essential utility,” Corbyn said. “I think it’s too important to be left to the corporations. Only the government has the planning ability, economies of scale and ambition to take this on.”\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe other side: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003eConservative Prime Minister Boris Johnson thinks the policy is a “crazed communist scheme.” And Chancellor of the Exchequer Sajid Javid \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.theguardian.com/technology/2019/nov/15/free-broadband-essential-uk-compete-john-mcdonnell-labour-policy-openreach?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003equipped\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, “Labour are on track to beat their last manifesto record of using the word ‘free’ 39 times.”\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eHow nationalization works\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eLabour would turn BT’s broadband operations and related units into a state-run company called \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/british-labour-party-plans-to-nationalize-telecoms-if-it-gains-power-11573842024?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eBritish Broadband\u003c/a\u003e. Current BT shareholders would be compensated in government bonds, but analysts expect the assets to be undervalued during the transaction. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAnd when you build a great, big broadband network on your digital border, who pays for it? Big Tech. Labour plans to partially fund the $26 billion project with a tax on internet giants like Facebook, Amazon, and Google. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eHistory is \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/04485e9d13214220828687fc98c1408f?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003erepeating itself\u003c/a\u003e. Labour governments went on a nationalizing spree after WWII, until Margaret Thatcher’s Conservative government went on a \u003cem\u003eprivatizing \u003c/em\u003espree in the 1980s. Now, Corbyn and Labour want to nationalize the water companies, the postal service, and some railways. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eReality check: \u003c/strong\u003eLabour is trailing in the polls and isn’t expected to gain much holding value, Chinese e-commerce giant Alibaba was the \u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/graphics/where-hedge-funds-invest-13F/?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" Uber was a popular buy with $2.2 billion in new holding value. FYI, Uber shares are down ~14% since last quarter.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eTraditionally “safer” bets like Disney (down $1.4 billion in holding value) and Microsoft (down $1.7 billion) made Jillian Michaels proud.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://finance.yahoo.com/news/hedge-funds-shop-netflix-facebook-235929426.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eFAANG\u003c/a\u003e stocks are still a faan favorite, but hedge funds also bet big on the broader market in Q3. style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nTwitter Changes Color Scheme to Gray\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Twitter CEO Jack Dorsey \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eDrew Angerer, Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThings that sound simple in theory but are complicated in practice: being the big spoon, waxing, and Twitter’s ban on political advertisements.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen Twitter announced that ban last month, it earned wide \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/15/tech/twitter-political-ad-rules/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epraise\u003c/a\u003e mostly for not being Facebook, which still allows political ads. Yesterday, Twitter revealed \u003ca href=\"https://www.axios.com/twitter-political-ad-rules-10b6b742-12d1-44a5-8a2e-32aafa800d47.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efresh details\u003c/a\u003e... \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat’s banned:\u003c/strong\u003e “Content that \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/recode/2019/11/15/20966908/twitter-political-ad-ban-policies-issue-ads-jack-dorsey?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ereferences\u003c/a\u003e a candidate, political party, elected or appointed governmental official, election, referendum, ballot measure, legislation, regulation, directive, or judicial outcome.”\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eTwitter’s also limiting micro-targeting, or serving ads \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/twitter-to-restrict-how-certain-advertisers-target-users-11573842679?mod=hp_lead_pos2\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ebased on\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e things like ZIP code or political affiliation, on issues-based ads related to civic engagement, the economy, etc.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWho’s banned:\u003c/strong\u003e Candidates, parties, government officials, PACs, and political nonprofits. For-profit companies can run ads to raise awareness around issues, but those ads can’t advocate for specific political outcomes. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Scientists say exercise is good for you\" is fine.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\"Vote for my law abolishing school and enshrining 24/7 recess\"...not so much.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe line is fine.\u003c/strong\u003e Twitter’s policy leaves \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/15/technology/twitter-political-ad-policy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eroom for interpretation\u003c/a\u003e defining ads for \u003cem\u003eissues\u003c/em\u003e vs. ads for \u003cem\u003eoutcomes\u003c/em\u003e. And it doesn't do much to address disinformation. \u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eRaise your hand if you’ve had this experience: twist ankle → go to doctor → get told it’s probably fine but might have foot diarrhea → href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/11/15/health/list-hospital-prices-trump.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esaid it plans\u003c/a\u003e to fix that by requiring hospitals to publicize the rates they negotiate with insurers. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThose rates have been the most closely guarded secret in the healthcare industry, aside from whether or not coffee is good for you. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, down\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe administration says disclosing the rates would \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/trump-administration-releases-transparency-rule-in-hospital-pricing-11573825649?mod=hp_lead_pos3\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003egenerate competition\u003c/a\u003e among \u003cspan\u003edoctors\u003c/span\u003e and push prices down. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eThe administration also floated a rule that would force insurers to inform people about their \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eestimated\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e out-of-pocket costs prior to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cspan\u003eseeing a doctor or going to a hospital\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eZoom out: \u003c/strong\u003eThe 2020 election is at the next exit, and some of President Trump’s style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith two new competitors this month and two more in the on-deck circle, streaming feels like it’s reached a saturation style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWe’ve seen experiments in \u003ca href=\"https://www.fastcompany.com/90326433/what-history-teaches-us-about-the-future-of-interactive-tv?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einteractive\u003c/a\u003e content (Netflix’s \u003cem\u003eBlack Mirror: \u003c/em\u003e\u003cem\u003eBandersnatch\u003c/em\u003e, a choose-your-own-adventure movie) and \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/longform/virtual-reality-struggle-hope-vr/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003evirtual reality\u003c/a\u003e, but the next wave of streaming might happen on your phone. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe startup to watch:\u003c/strong\u003e Quibi, short for “quick bites,” \u003ca href=\"https://www.latimes.com/entertainment-arts/story/2019-07-31/can-quibi-reinvent-mobile-storytelling?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earrives\u003c/a\u003e in April under the leadership of former Disney Chairman Jeffrey Katzenberg and former HPE CEO Meg Whitman. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eUsers will pay $5/month for ad-supported streaming or $8/month for an ad-free version on Quibi’s app. The target audience? 18\u003cspan\u003e–\u003c/span\u003e35-year-olds who want a few minutes of entertainment while scarfing down Sweetgreen at their desks. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eEach video will log around 10 minutes. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe confirmed list of creators includes heavyweights like Steven Spielberg, Queen Latifah, and Trevor Noah. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe goal: \u003c/strong\u003eKatzenberg \u003ca href=\"https://fortune.com/longform/katzenberg-whitman-hollywood-mobile-streaming-quibi/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e Fortune that “five or 10 years from now, we’ll look back and go, ‘There was the era of movies, there was the era of television, and there’s the era of Quibi.’” \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eHe’s not lacking confidence, and Quibi’s not lacking advertisers. Six months before launch, Quibi said it \u003ca href=\"https://techcrunch.com/2019/10/23/streaming-service-quibi-sells-out-of-its-150m-in-first-year-ad-inventory/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esold out\u003c/a\u003e all $150 million of its first-year ad
